channel.title: CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science
channel.description: Recent content on CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science

item.title: Dimensionality Reduction
item.description: Exploratory Data Analysis of high-dimensional data using dimensionality reduction. Lecture Notes

item.title: Project 3: Classification and Regression
item.description: This project has two parts: a. Regression b. Classification Follow instructions on each of these two to complete your project. DUE Dec 2, 2016 Submission Prepare and knit a single Rmarkdown file that includes submission information described in each of the two project parts above. All axes in plots should be labeled in an informative manner. Your answers to any question that refers to a plot should include both (a) a text description of your plot, and (b) a sentence or two of interpretation as it relates to the question asked.

item.title: Evaluation
item.description: How to use sampling methods to evaluate statistical models Lecture notes

item.title: Learning at scale
item.description: Systems and algorithms for data summarization and learning on large datasets Lecture notes on Stochastic Gradient Descent

item.title: Tree-based methods
item.description: Regression and Decision Trees. Random Forests. Lecture Notes Resources ISLR Ch. 8

item.title: Linear models for regression and classification
item.description: Basic models for regression and classification Lecture Notes: Simple linear regression Lecture Notes: Multiple linear regression Lecture Notes: Linear models for classification Resources ISLR, Ch. 3 and 4 Zumel & Mount Ch. 7

item.title: Introduction to Statistical Learning
item.description: Introduction to randomness, distributions, inference and testing Lecture Notes: Distributions, Inference and Testing Resources Intro Stat with Randomization and Simulation OpenIntro Statistics - Cartoon guide to Statistics

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
item.description: Visualization and summarization methods for effective data exploration. Lecture Notes: Data visualization for EDA Lecture Notes: Data summarization for EDA Lecture Notes: Data transformations Lecture Notes: Handling missing data Additional Resources Derivative review Zumen & Mount Ch. 3 R for Data Science Ch. 7 ggplot2 cheatsheet ggplot2 textbook

item.title: Modeling and tidying data
item.description: How to get data into shape before analysis Lecture notes: Data models Lecture notes: Tidy data Readings and resources H. Wickham (2014). Tidy data. Journal of Statistical Software H. Wickham (2016). R for Data Science

item.title: Data Wrangling
item.description: Data management and manipulation Data wrangling with dplyr Data wrangling with SQL Additional Resources Introduction to dplyr: http://cran.rstudio.com/web/packages/dplyr/vignettes/introduction.html dplyr Cheatsheet: http://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/data-wrangling-cheatsheet.pdf

item.title: Best Practices
item.description: Tips for organizing and managing data science projects Slides

item.title: Measurement and data types
item.description: Examples of data sets, data types and measurements Lecture Notes

item.title: Setting up R
item.description: For class we will be using R, Rstudio and git. You can download and install each using the links below. However, you can instead use Rocker, a project built on top of Docker to manage your software installation. We’ve setup a container that will provide you with a working installation of R, and the Rstudio IDE, along with a lot of packages providing analysis tools and datasets we will use throughout the semester.

item.title: R for Data Science Primer
item.description: An introduction to the R programming language and data analysis environment Part I: (html) (Rmarkdown) Part II: (html) (Rmarkdown) Part III: A short note about pipes (html) (Rmarkdown) Additional Resources Course resource page Zumen & Mount, Appendix A Wickham, H. Advanced R Rmarkdown

item.title: Lecture Notes: Introduction
item.description: What is Data Science? Slides Readings Zumel & Mount: pp. xix-17 Loukides, What is data science? Silver, What the fox knows

item.title: CMSC320 Projects
item.description: Data scraping and cleaning Due Oct. 10, 2016 Data wrangling and EDA Due Nov. 2, 2016 Regression and classification Due Dec. 2, 2016 Interactive data visualization and mapping Due Dec. 12, 2016

item.title: CMSC320 Resources
item.description: R R is an open-source environment for data analysis. The RStudio IDE is highly recommended. The Revolution IDE is also very good, only Linux and Windows. swirl is an interactive R (and general data analysis) tutorial Data Camp has a nice short online course introducing R R Task Views: The Machine Learning and Optimization Task Views list useful packages in R we may use.

item.title: Logistics
item.description: This page constiutes the official syllabus for this class. Course Information Introduction to Data Science CMSC320 Fall 2016 Lecture Meeting Times Monday and Wednesday, 2:00pm-3:15pm, CSI 3117 Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: 3114F Biomolecular Sciences Building Phone Number: 301-405-2481 Office Hours: Friday 1:00pm-2:00pm AVW 3223 and by appointment Communication: For course related questions, use Piazza as indicated below.

item.title: CMSC320: Introduction to Data Science
item.description: Course Information CMSC320: Introduction to Data Science Fall 2016 Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: 3114F Biomolecular Sciences Building Lecture Meeting Times Monday and Wendesday, 2:00pm-3:15pm, CSI 3117 Links Check the calendar page for up-to-date course calendar. Check the logistics page for more information, including the official syllabus. Grades and assignments posted in ELMS. Discussion and questions in Piazza.

item.title: Support Vector Machines and KNN
item.description: Linear and non-linear regression and classification with support vector machines and KNN Lecture notes Resources ISLR Ch. 9
